hero.title: Consultation & Diagnosis
hero.subtitle: Complete and accurate assessment of your oral health

consultation.title: Dental Consultation
consultation.description: The dental consultation is the first step to ensure a healthy mouth.
consultation.content: During the consultation, the dentist performs a detailed assessment of your oral health, analyzing teeth, gums, bite and oral tissues. The goal is to identify existing problems or prevent future complications, creating a personalized treatment plan.

radiology.title: Digital Radiographs
radiology.content: Digital radiographs allow visualization of internal structures of teeth and bones that are not visible to the naked eye. They are fast, safe and use a minimum dose of radiation, helping in the diagnosis of cavities, infections, bone problems and treatment planning.

emergency.title: Dental Emergencies
emergency.description: Quick care when you need it most
emergency.content: Dental emergencies include situations such as intense pain, infections, trauma, dental fractures, persistent bleeding or swelling. In these cases, you should contact the clinic as soon as possible. Until evaluated, avoid excessive self-medication and, if there is bleeding, apply gentle compression with clean gauze.

cta.title: Take care of your oral health
cta.subtitle: Don't wait for pain. Schedule your appointment today.

prices.title: Affordable
prices.description: We offer competitive prices and special discounts for members. Taking care of your smile has never been so affordable.

membership.title: Become a Member and Save
membership.description: With our membership plan, you have access to exclusive discounts on all treatments, free consultations and priority scheduling.

prices.note: * Prices shown are indicative and may vary according to treatment complexity. Contact us for a personalized quote.

member.quote: Our commitment is to provide the best dental care, with advanced technology and humane and personalized service.

amenities.title: We think about your

faq.subtitle: We've gathered the most common questions from our patients. If you can't find the answer you're looking for, don't hesitate to contact us.

cta.text: Still have questions? We're here to help!

hours.q: What are the clinic's opening hours?
hours.a: Our clinic is open Monday to Friday from 9am to 7pm, and Saturdays from 9am to 1pm. We are closed on Sundays and holidays.

appointment.q: Do I need to book an appointment?
appointment.a: Yes, we always recommend booking in advance to ensure the best service. However, in case of emergency, we will do our best to see you on the same day.

payments.a: We accept payment in cash, debit card, MBWay and bank transfer. We also offer payment facilities and financing for more extensive treatments.

insurance.q: Does the clinic work with health insurance?
insurance.a: Yes, we work with most health insurance and subsystems. Contact us to check if your insurance is included in our list of agreements.

routine_duration.q: How long does a routine consultation take?
routine_duration.a: A routine consultation, including check-up and scaling, takes approximately 45 minutes to 1 hour, depending on each patient's needs.

pain.a: We use modern techniques and local anesthesia to ensure maximum comfort during all procedures. Most patients do not feel pain during treatments.

kids_first_visit.q: From what age should children go to the dentist?
kids_first_visit.a: We recommend the first visit to the dentist around the child's first birthday or when the first teeth appear. Regular consultations help prevent future problems.

implant_duration.q: How long does a dental implant last?
implant_duration.a: With proper care, a dental implant can last a lifetime. It is essential to maintain good oral hygiene and regular check-up consultations.

whitening.a: No, when performed by qualified professionals with appropriate products, whitening is safe and does not damage tooth enamel.

booking.q: How can I book an appointment?
booking.a: You can book your appointment by phone 924 123 784, by email to geral@silvioaraujo.com, or through the booking form on our website.

appointment.title: Schedule your appointment
appointment.description: Fill out the form and our team will contact you to confirm your appointment.

form.privacyNote: By submitting, you agree to our privacy policy.

toast.title: Booking Request Sent!
toast.description: We will contact you shortly to confirm your appointment.

article1.excerpt: Discover the best practices for brushing your teeth correctly and keeping your mouth healthy every day.

article2.title: Everything about teeth whitening
article2.excerpt: Learn about the different types of whitening and which is most suitable for your case.

higiene.title: How to maintain good daily oral hygiene
higiene.description: Discover the best practices for brushing your teeth correctly and maintaining impeccable oral hygiene every day.
higiene.intro: Oral hygiene is essential to maintain healthy teeth and gums throughout life.
higiene.whyTitle: Why is oral hygiene so important?
higiene.whyText: The mouth is the gateway to our body. When we neglect oral hygiene, we allow harmful bacteria to accumulate.
higiene.pillarsTitle: The pillars of good oral hygiene
higiene.brushingText: Brush your teeth at least twice a day with gentle movements.
higiene.flossText: Dental floss removes food debris and bacterial plaque between teeth.
higiene.mouthwashText: Mouthwash helps eliminate bacteria and strengthens tooth enamel.
higiene.tipsText: Avoid sugar, drink water, don't smoke and visit the dentist regularly.
higiene.conclusionText: Good oral hygiene ensures a healthy smile for life.
higiene.ctaText: Schedule a consultation for a complete evaluation.
higiene.lead: Small daily habits make a big difference. Here's a practical guide to keep teeth and gums healthy â€” at home and between appointments.

toc.title: In this article
toc.note: Need a personalized plan? We can evaluate your routine and recommend the best products and techniques.

takeaways.title: Key points
takeaways.one: Brush 2Ã—/day for 2 minutes with gentle technique and fluoride toothpaste.
takeaways.two: Clean between teeth daily (floss or interdental brushes) â€” that's where many cavities start.
takeaways.three: Reduce sugar between meals and avoid constant 'snacking'; water is your best ally.

cavities.title: Fewer cavities
cavities.text: Plaque and sugar feed bacteria that weaken enamel.

gums.title: Healthier gums
gums.text: Bleeding is not normal â€” it's a sign of inflammation.

breath.title: Fresher breath
breath.text: Cleaning tongue + interdental areas reduces odor.

1.title: Brush (2 minutes)
1.text: Use a soft brush and fluoride toothpaste. Focus on the gum line and all surfaces.

2.title: Clean between teeth
2.text: Use dental floss or interdental brushes 1Ã—/day. Removes plaque where the brush doesn't reach.

3.title: Tongue cleaning
3.text: Clean the tongue gently to reduce bacteria and improve breath.

4.title: Mouthwash (optional)
4.text: Use alcohol-free mouthwash when recommended. Avoid rinsing right after brushing to keep fluoride longer.

tech.do1: Use small circular movements with gentle pressure.
tech.do2: Tilt the brush ~45Â° towards the gum line.
tech.do3: Change brush/head every ~3 months (or earlier if bristles open).
tech.avoid1: Brushing too hard (can cause gum recession and sensitivity).
tech.avoid2: Ignoring the gum line â€” that's where plaque accumulates most.
tech.avoid3: Brushing immediately after acidic drinks; wait ~30 minutes.

higiene.flossSectionText: Many cavities and gum problems start between teeth. If floss is difficult, interdental brushes can be a great alternative â€” ask what size is ideal for you.
higiene.flossHowTitle: How to use dental floss (in 3 steps)
higiene.flossHow1: Pass gently between teeth and make a 'C' around the tooth.
higiene.flossHow2: Move up and down on both sides of the tooth.
higiene.flossHow3: Use a clean part of the floss for each space.

diet.good2: Prefer snacks with less sugar (nuts, cheese, yogurt).
diet.good3: Chew sugar-free gum after meals (if indicated) to stimulate saliva.
diet.limit2: Sipping sodas/juices slowly for a long time (constant acid).
diet.limit3: Tobacco (increases risk of gum disease and stains).

higiene.warningSubtitle: If you notice any of these signs, consider booking an evaluation:

warning.1: Gums bleeding when brushing or flossing
warning.5: Pain when chewing or jaw discomfort

faq.q1: If gums bleed, should I stop flossing?
faq.a1: Usually not. Bleeding is usually a sign of inflammation. Use floss gently and consistently; if it persists after 1â€“2 weeks, get evaluated.
faq.a2: Not always. It can help in specific cases (gingivitis, high cavity risk). The essential is brushing + interdental cleaning.
faq.q3: Is an electric brush worth it?
faq.a3: For many people, yes â€” it improves consistency and plaque removal. Still, technique is important.

finalCta.title: Want a personalized oral hygiene plan?
finalCta.text: We can evaluate your gums, cavity risk and recommend products and techniques adjusted to your case.

estetica.title: Everything about teeth whitening
estetica.description: Learn about the different types of teeth whitening and which is most suitable for you. Complete guide on dental aesthetics.
estetica.lead: Teeth whitening is one of the most sought-after aesthetic procedures in dental clinics. A whiter smile can significantly increase self-confidence and improve the overall appearance of the face.

toc.title: In this article
toc.note: Want a whiter smile? Schedule an evaluation to find out which type of whitening is best for you.

takeaways.title: Key points
takeaways.one: Professional whitening is safe and effective
takeaways.two: Results can last from 1 to 3 years

estetica.causesText: Teeth can darken for various reasons over time. Understanding the causes helps prevent and choose the most appropriate treatment.

food.title: Food and drinks
food.text: Coffee, tea, red wine and soft drinks with dyes

tobacco.title: Tobacco
tobacco.text: Smoking is one of the main causes of tooth stains

age.title: Age
age.text: Enamel wears naturally, revealing the more yellowish dentin

medication.title: Medications
medication.text: Certain antibiotics and treatments can cause discoloration

office.title: 1. In-office whitening
office.text: Performed by the dentist, uses products with higher concentration of whitening agents, providing visible results in a single session. It is the fastest and most effective method.

home.title: 2. Supervised home whitening
home.text: The dentist makes custom trays and provides the whitening gel for home use. It is a more economical and comfortable option, although results take longer to appear.
home.application: Application: A few hours a day or during the night
home.advantage: Advantage: Can touch up when needed

combined.title: 3. Combined whitening
combined.text: Combines an in-office session with home maintenance treatment, offering the best of both methods: fast and lasting results.

estetica.safetyText: Yes, when performed or supervised by a qualified dentist. The products used in clinics are safe and tested. There may be some temporary sensitivity, which disappears after treatment.

aftercare.1: Avoid intensely colored foods and drinks in the first 48 hours
aftercare.4: Make regular visits to the dentist for maintenance

estetica.durationText: Results can last from 1 to 3 years, depending on eating habits, oral hygiene and lifestyle. Periodic maintenance treatments help prolong the effect.

finalCta.title: Want a whiter smile?
finalCta.text: Schedule an evaluation to find out which type of whitening is best for you.

implantes.title: Dental implants: complete guide
implantes.description: Everything you need to know about dental implants, from procedure to recovery. Complete guide on implantology.
implantes.lead: Dental implants are the most modern and effective solution to replace missing teeth. They function as artificial roots that support crowns, bridges or prosthetics, providing natural and lasting results.

toc.title: In this article
toc.note: Want to recover your smile? Schedule a free evaluation to find out if implants are suitable for you.

takeaways.title: Key points
takeaways.two: Can last a lifetime with proper care
takeaways.three: Preserve jaw bone and adjacent teeth

implantes.whatText: A dental implant is a small titanium screw that is surgically inserted into the jaw or mandibular bone. Titanium is a biocompatible material, which means the body accepts it and bone grows around it, creating a solid base for the new tooth.

implant.title: Implant
implant.text: Titanium screw inserted into the bone

abutment.title: Abutment
abutment.text: Connection piece between implant and crown

advantages.2: Durability - can last a lifetime with proper care
advantages.7: Improve self-esteem and quality of life

implantes.eligibilityText1: Most adults with good general health can receive dental implants. However, a careful evaluation is necessary to determine if you are a good candidate.
implantes.eligibilityText2: Factors that can affect eligibility include:

eligibility.1: Amount and quality of available bone
eligibility.2: General health and medical conditions (diabetes, osteoporosis)

phase1.title: Phase 1: Evaluation and planning
phase1.text: The dentist performs detailed clinical and radiographic exams, including 3D CT scan, to evaluate the bone and plan the ideal implant position.

phase2.title: Phase 2: Implant placement
phase2.text: Under local anesthesia, the implant is inserted into the bone. The procedure is usually painless. A temporary tooth can be placed on the same day (immediate loading) in selected cases.

phase3.title: Phase 3: Osseointegration
phase3.text: For 3 to 6 months, the bone integrates with the implant. This period is crucial for long-term success.

phase4.title: Phase 4: Placement of definitive crown
phase4.text: After healing, the abutment and definitive crown are placed, custom-made to perfectly match your natural teeth.

implantes.recoveryText: Initial recovery lasts a few days to a week. During this period:

recovery.1: There may be some swelling and mild discomfort
recovery.3: Avoid hard foods in the operated area

implantes.successText: Dental implants have a success rate above 95% when placed by experienced professionals and with proper care. With regular maintenance, they can last a lifetime.
implantes.costText: Cost varies depending on the number of implants, type of crown and additional procedures needed (such as bone graft). We offer financing options to make treatment accessible.

finalCta.title: Want to recover your smile?
finalCta.text: Schedule a free evaluation to find out if dental implants are the ideal solution for you.

odontopediatria.title: When to take children to the dentist?
odontopediatria.description: Find out the ideal age for the first consultation and how to prepare the little ones for a positive experience at the dentist.
odontopediatria.lead: Children's oral health is fundamental for their development. Many parents wonder when they should take their children to the dentist for the first time and how to make this experience positive.

toc.title: In this article
toc.note: Our team is prepared to receive the little ones with all the care and attention.

odontopediatria.idealAgeTitle: What is the ideal age for the first consultation?
odontopediatria.idealAgeText: The first visit to the dentist should occur when the first tooth appears or, at the latest, by the child's first birthday. This initial consultation is essential to:

idealAge.3: Guide parents on children's oral hygiene
idealAge.4: Create a positive relationship between child and dentist

odontopediatria.preparationTitle: How to prepare the child for the consultation?

1.title: Speak positively:
1.text: Avoid using words like 'pain', 'injection' or 'pull out'

2.title: Read books:
2.text: There are children's stories about visits to the dentist

3.title: Play dentist:
3.text: Simulate a consultation at home with dolls

4.title: Choose the right time:
4.text: Prefer times when the child is rested

during.2: Let the dentist communicate directly with the child
during.3: Avoid making promises of exaggerated rewards
during.4: Praise the child's behavior after the consultation

bottle.title: Bottle cavities
bottle.text: Occur when the child falls asleep with a bottle of milk or juice in the mouth. To prevent, clean teeth after each feeding and avoid sugary drinks in the bottle.

thumb.title: Thumb sucking
thumb.text: It is natural in the first years, but should be discouraged after 4 years to avoid changes in tooth positioning and dental arch development.

trauma.title: Dental trauma
trauma.text: Falls and accidents are common in childhood. In case of dental trauma, seek a dentist immediately, even if there appears to be no visible damage.

0to2.title: 0-2 years
0to2.text: Clean gums with a damp gauze. When first teeth appear, use a baby brush with water.

2to6.title: 2-6 years
2to6.text: Use fluoride toothpaste (pea-sized amount). Parents should supervise and help with brushing.

6plus.title: 6+ years
6plus.text: The child can brush alone, but parents should check. Introduce floss use when teeth start touching.

odontopediatria.frequencyTitle: How often to go to the dentist?
odontopediatria.frequencyText: After the first consultation, it is recommended to visit the dentist every 6 months for routine check-ups. This frequency allows detecting and treating problems early, when they are easier to solve.

finalCta.title: Is it time for your child's first consultation?
finalCta.text: Our team is prepared to receive the little ones with all the care and attention.
